collation.note:
It is difficult to distinguish the original quires. Probably the sewing of the quires has been redone. Many false guard leaves, paper and parchment, have been added when the manuscript was rebound by .
13810

binding.decoNote:
European binding; leather covering with gold leaf. The inner cover is reinforced with decorative paper. The title is given on the spine by in French with golden letters. Many false paper and parchment guard leaves have been added. The edges were gilded, probably after the folios were recut.
13810

collation.note: Three leaves have been added to the front of the codex.

decoNote.desc:
Well executed ink drawing of a flying eagle holding a scroll with his beak and claws.
14542

item.q: From Ras Michael, Governor of the Province of Tigre, in Abyssinia.

msItem.title: ክብረ፡ ነገሥት።
msItem.incipit: በአኰቴቱ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አኃዜ፡ ኵሉ፡ ወበወልዱ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ኵሉ፡ ኮነ፡ ዘእንበሌሁሰ፡ አልቦ፡ ዘኮነ። ወበመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ዘይወፅእ፡ እምአብ፡ ወይነሥእ፡ እምወልድ፡ ፩ አምላክ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ነአምን፡ ወንገኒ፡ ለሥሉስ።
msItem.note: The titles of the 117 chapters are included in the text.
The colophon which is usually included in manuscripts containing the is absent in this manuscript. 148
The description of the content of this manuscript follows .

msItem.incipit: ከመዝ፡ ኑባሬ፡ ሥርዓታ፡ ለእምነ፡ ጽዮን፡ ገበዘ፡ አክሱም፡

msItem.note: The text is copied continuously after , but the beginning is rubricated.

msItem.title: List of dignitaries and the "Daughters of Ṣǝyon"
List of the twelve Houses of Israel which accompanied ʾƎbna Ḥakim to Ethiopia
List of the compulsory labours during the construction of the church of ʾAksum Ṣǝyon
Chronology from ʾabbā Salāmā to Śarṣa Dǝngǝl
History of the foundation of ʾAksum
msItem.incipit: ከመዝአ፡ ጥንተ፡ ሡራሬሃ፡ ለእምነ፡ ጽዮን፡ ገበዘ፡ አክሱም።

msItem.title: List of Kings who will reign at the end of the world, according to Clement
Chronology of Umayyad and Abbasid califs, of the Fatimids and Ayyubites until 659 H.
ዝውእቱ፡ ዜና፡ ስሞሙ፡ ለአበዊነ፡ ሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘለእስክንድርያ፡

item.desc: Pencil notes, mainly English translations of certain words, probably added by or a collaborator, such as .
